The tree produces small, spherical cones that release seeds when mature, aiding in its reproduction. Its bark is reddish-brown and becomes furrowed with age, while its needles are covered in a sticky resin. The balsam fir is often found in boreal and mountainous regions, thriving in cool, moist environments.
